Name: Siege of Smerwick
Description: "The Warlike GRAY, whose actions Tragicall, Did likewyse curbe their mindes Imperiall, Gives document: Fitzwilliams, and the rest, In those proceedings ever highly blest." - J.G.E [Anthony Nixon], England's Hope Against Irish Hate
Author: Anthony Nixon

Name: Kilcolman Castle
Description: "Under the foot of Mole that mountain hore, Keeping my sheepe amongst the cooly shade, Of the greene alders by the Mullaes shore: There a straunge shepard chaunst to find me out" - Edmund Spenser, Colin Clouts Come Home Againe
Author: Edmund Spenser

Name: Lixnaw Castle
Description: "I have often received cold wine and esteem before a host of horsemen in your court, the wine that I used to drink from gold [cups] I must [now] recompense with sorrow" - � D�laigh Fionn, Farewell, o Lixnaw
Author: � D�laigh Fionn

Name: Musicians in Fiants
Description: "Pardon to Wm. oge O Downie, haper"
Author: William oge O'Downie

Name: Henry Sidney's Memoir
Description: "I saw Limerick and Kilmallock well furnished with men, munition and victual, and taking order for the victualling of the garrison there left, which was 200 footmen"
Author: Henry Sidney
